page.title: 13THE ROYAL MARINES
page.content: Some of Woodbury Common is used by the marines for military training.It has been used for this since the second world war.The marine camp used to be situated on the common, but now is at Lympstone. The sort of training carried out is combat skills,patrolling,section and troop attacks and defence exercises. Fitness training is done in most of our area,especially using the country lanes.The endurance course runs across Lypmstone Common. Live ammunition is not used on the Common except on the Grenade Range which is out of our area.Weapons used are Self Loading Rifles,General Purpose Machine Guns,and occasionally Carl Gustav anti-tank guns. The land the marines use is leased from Clinton Devon Estates.
